definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: John was too lazy to work and too proud to beg.
sentences.chinese: 約翰懶惰成性，不願工作，又心高氣傲，不肯乞討。

sentences.english: But when he became powerful, his heart became proud.
I was so heart was lifted so near so ashamed to see my thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 我是如此心高氣傲，這樣羞恥讓邇看到我的思想。

sentences.english: Because your beloved is so proud a person.
sentences.chinese: 因爲你深愛的他是一個如此心高氣傲的人。

definition: to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
not recognizing one's family (idiom); self-centered and not making any allowances for the needs of one's relatives
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
to whisper to one another's ear
old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
